safe.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: not in danger of being harmed, lost, or stolen
safe.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: She doesn’t feel safe in the house on her own.
Make sure you keep these documents safe.
Your money will be as safe as houses.
The birds’ nests are high up, safe from predators.
safe.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The missing children were found safe and sound.
safe.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: not likely to cause any physical injury or harm
safe.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Flying is one of the safest forms of travel.
Don’t go near the edge – it isn’t safe.
The water is treated to make it safe to drink.
We watched from a safe distance.
Drivers should keep a safe distance from the car in front.
Women are safer drivers than men.
Is it safe to swim here?
it is safe (for somebody) to do something
play areas that are safe for children
safe.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: not involving any risk and very likely to be successful
safe.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I think it’s safe to say that the future is looking pretty good.
safe.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a safe subject of conversation is not likely to upset anyone or make people argue
safe.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: I kept to safe subjects, like the weather.
safe.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: used to say that something is good and that there is no problem
safe.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: not in danger
safe
not in danger of being harmed, lost, or stolen. Also used about a place where someone or something is safe
I don’t feel safe around here.
Keep your valuables in a safe place.
secure
if something is secure, it is safe from thieves and criminals. Also used about a place where something is safe
How do I know that my personal details are secure?
The money is in a very secure place.
well protected
not likely to be damaged or harmed by something
The equipment was well protected from the rain.
Always make sure that you are well protected from the sun.
out of harm’s way
in a place where someone or something cannot be hurt or damaged
She put the glass vases on the top shelf, out of harm’s way.
Make sure that he stays out of harm’s way.
not harmed or damaged
safe
not harmed or damaged
The children are all safe.
OK/all right
safe and not hurt
I was glad to hear that you were OK.
unharmed
not hurt
The kidnappers released the young man unharmed.
unscathed
not hurt or damaged, after an accident, an attack, or a dangerous experience – used when you are surprised by this
The baby escaped unscathed.
Miraculously, the old part of the city remained unscathed.
in one piece
not harmed or damaged, especially after a journey or a dangerous experience
I’m glad you’re home in one piece.
out of danger
safe, after being in a dangerous situation
As soon as they were out of danger, they stopped for a rest.
His doctors say he is out of danger.

safe.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: said by young people as a greeting
